Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate plants with enough water and light, showing them as healthy and growing.
The student can illustrate plants without enough water, showing them as wilting or dried up.
The student can illustrate plants without enough light, showing them as weak or pale.
The student can show the pattern that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can include in their illustration different types of environments where plants might or might not get enough water or light (e.g., under a porch, in a sunny garden).
